forecast-period.text: Wind gusts can be 40 percent stronger than the averages given here, and maximum waves may be up to twice the height. Wind warnings are issued for today and tomorrow and describe the highest category of wind warning for that day.

area.description: Beagle Bonaparte Coast: WA-NT Border to Cape Fourcroy

forecast-period.text: Winds: Southwesterly 10 to 15 knots turning westerly below 10 knots in the morning. Seas: Below 1 metre. Swell: Westerly below 1 metre. Weather: Partly cloudy. 60% chance of showers. The chance of a thunderstorm.
Winds: West to southwesterly about 10 knots. Seas: Below 1 metre. Swell: Westerly below 1 metre. Weather: Partly cloudy. 50% chance of showers. The chance of a thunderstorm.
Winds: Variable about 10 knots. Seas: Below 1 metre. Swell: Westerly below 1 metre. Weather: Partly cloudy. 40% chance of showers. The chance of a thunderstorm in the morning and afternoon.

area.description: Gove Peninsula Coast: Cape Wessel to Cape Arnhem

forecast-period.text: Winds: West to southwesterly 10 to 15 knots, reaching up to 20 knots in the far northeast in the early afternoon. Winds decreasing to about 10 knots in the evening. Seas: Around 1 metre, decreasing below 1 metre later in the evening. Swell: West to northwesterly 1 to 1.5 metres offshore, decreasing to around 1 metre later in the evening. Weather: Partly cloudy. 60% chance of showers offshore, 30% chance elsewhere. The chance of a thunderstorm offshore.

Winds: West to southwesterly about 10 knots. Seas: Below 1 metre. Swell: West to northwesterly around 1 metre offshore. Weather: Partly cloudy. 50% chance of showers offshore, 30% chance elsewhere. The chance of a thunderstorm.
Winds: Variable about 10 knots. Seas: Below 0.5 metres. Swell: Northwesterly below 1 metre. Weather: Partly cloudy. 50% chance of showers. The chance of a thunderstorm.
